meanings.sent1: Breakfast always precedes lunch in the daily schedule.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the introduction precedes the main plot.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel precedes the birds to the feeder every morning.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the holiday season precedes the arrival of snow.
meanings.sent5: The sound of thunder precedes the flash of lightning in a storm.

meanings.sent1: The lead car precedes the rest of the vehicles in the parade.
meanings.sent2: The guide dog always precedes its owner when walking.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight precedes his companions into battle.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked bread precedes the opening of the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The scout precedes the group to ensure the path is safe.

meanings.definition: Be higher in rank or importance
meanings.sent1: Experience often precedes knowledge in the journey of learning.
meanings.sent2: In the military, the general precedes the colonel in rank.
meanings.sent3: The wise elder precedes the young ones in making decisions.
meanings.sent4: The safety of the passengers precedes the convenience of the airline.
meanings.sent5: The health of the community precedes the profits of a business.
